title: Biden signs debt ceiling bill that pulls US back from brink of unprecedented default
description: Biden says the bill saves the US from 'economic collapse'. It also suspends the debt limit until 2025 – after the next presidential election.

title: To withstand deep water's cold temperatures, hammerhead sharks stop breathing
description: These carnivorous fish that can dive to depths of 800 meters, close their gills to prevent heat loss.

title: South Korea rocked by massive financial scandal
description: Over the past few weeks, the financial hub of Seoul has been shaken with revelations of possible insider trading that led to the collapse of stocks of very large companies. Massive sales of shares were allegedly carried out by a subsidiary of Société Générale.

title: Death toll rises to 15 as tensions persist in Senegal
description: Clashes broke out after opposition leader Ousmane Sonko was sentenced to two years in prison on Thursday. His conviction may prevent him from running for president in 2014.

title: How France's foreign intelligence service is recruiting its latest talent
description: To identify cybersecurity profiles and meet the shortage of specialists in the field, the French intelligence service, known as DGSE in France, organizes hacking competitions at engineering schools in the country.

title: Paris 2024: Versailles and its palace want culture and sport to coexist
description: In the run-up to the Olympic and Paralympic Games, held from July to September 2024, the French city, where equestrian sporting events will take place, is bolstering its cultural offerings.

title: The bittersweet exile of carbon swindler millionaires, convicted in France and stuck in Israel
description: Some 30 French-Israelis sentenced in France for their participation in the gigantic 2008-2009 carbon VAT fraud are taking advantage of cumbersome extradition procedures to live in Israel. Le Monde investigated this community where money, as the proverb goes, cannot buy happiness.

title: Groundbreaking plastic pollution treaty moves closer after Paris talks, despite fractured reactions
description: After a week of intense negotiations, a mandate was given to the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee to prepare a first draft text on cutting the world's plastic pollution before the end of the year.

title: Three Israel soldiers killed on Egyptian border
description: A deadly shooting triggered a manhunt in the border area during which the assailant was also killed, the army said.

title: In the Brazilian Amazon, land for sale on Facebook
description: Continuing the work of British journalist Dom Phillips, murdered in June 2022, the Forbidden Stories consortium and its media partners are uncovering an organized system of land grabbing. At its head, a powerful landowner already implicated in the gigantic fires that ravaged the Amazon in 2019.

title: Why France's economy is staying afloat (in spite of everything)
description: France has been spared nothing: Covid, shortages, soaring energy prices, the war in Ukraine, inflation and social and political crises. Yet the country isn't sinking and continues to create jobs, even if structural weaknesses persist.

title: War in Ukraine: Fear and tension return to Kyiv as Moscow ups airstrikes
description: Russia's increased aerial attacks, which have become almost daily, are creating a climate of tension in the Ukrainian capital despite the effectiveness of the anti-aircraft defense.

title: Dakar university students in limbo after chaos from conviction of political opponent Sonko
description: Senegal's largest university has been closed 'until further notice' following intense clashes that have shaken the country since Thursday.

title: India three-train crash death toll climbs to over 280
description: Hundreds were also injured after two passenger trains derailed and debris hit a freight train in one of the country's deadliest train crashes in decades.

title: 'Inflation is an old phenomenon that remains poorly understood'
description: British economist Stephen King examines the relationship between inflation and the world powers over the past 2,000 years, from Roman emperors to modern-day central bankers, in his recently published book 'We Need to Talk About Inflation'.

title: Russia's war in Ukraine is also a culture war
description: Launched in February 2022, Russia's invasion of Ukraine is also coupled with a cultural conflict aimed at eradicating Ukrainian identity. But culture, used as a war weapon by the aggressor, also serves as a means of defense for Kyiv.

title: 'AI is a philosophical and economic storm with the makings of a revolution'
description: Philippe Escande in his economics column for 'Le Monde' says that the progenitors of AI fear the commercial and ethical risks as well as the existential threat to their companies posed by their creature.

title: YouTube will stop removing false claims of 2020 US election fraud
description: Anti-misinformation advocates are criticizing the Google-owned video website's decision, citing threats to democracy and the continued spread of disinformation.

title: Lionel Messi's father and agent, Jorge Messi, who has shaped football history behind the scenes
description: As Lionel Messi prepares for his imminent departure from PSG, his father, Jorge, is back at the center of the game negotiating the seven-time Ballon d'Or winner's next move.

title: European detainees released by Iran in prisoner swap arrive in Belgium
description: The release of one Dane and two Austrian-Iranian citizens was part of a prisoner swap in which Tehran got back an Iranian diplomat convicted and incarcerated in Belgium on terrorism charges.

title: Inflation, an enduring political trap for the French government
description: At a time when rising prices have become the main concern of the population, overshadowing a historic fall in unemployment, the tools available to the French government are limited.
